analyzed: yang rmi lam du lus kyi yan lag 'phel ba dang / na tshod rgas pa dang / bag ma len cing 'dus pa dang / skra dang kha spu 'dreg pa rmi ba yang mi shis pa yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du rkang pa gnyis kyi pags pa sa la ltung bar rmi ba yang mi dge ba yin no //

original: shin tu dga' dang rab khros pa'i //
analyzed: shin tu dga' dang rab khros pa'i //

analyzed: shi ba'i gnyen gyis spyos pa dang // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: rmi lam du shin tu dga' zhing rangs pa dang / rab tu @78b khros shing 'khrugs pa'i sngon chad shi ba'i nye du pha ma la sogs pas yid spyos pa rmis pa yang mi dge'o // mar me gza' dang skrar ma dang // so mig lha yi gzugs rnams ni //
translated: It is also non-virtuous to dream of being very happy and delighted, or of being very angry and upset, and of being scolded by dead relatives such as one's father and mother.

original: lhung ba 'am 'jig pa rmis pa 'am //
analyzed: lhung ba 'am 'jig pa rmis pa 'am //

analyzed: 'jig cing brlag par rmis pa yang shin tu mi dge ba yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du ri bo ral zhing 'jig pa rmis pa yang mi shis pa yin no //

translated: and entering and remaining in the womb of a mother again, are also inauspicious dreams.🔽Falling from a cliff or a house,

analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de ni gshin rje'i 'khor dus mtshan zhes bya ba yin par slob dpon dag 'dod do ; / nad ni stobs dang ldan pa yis //
translated: The masters assert that this is the retinue of Yama, the so-called “night of death.”🔽Because the powerful

translated: Because the passage of the mind that is to be trusted is blocked by disease,🔽one sees an unbearable dream that causes harm.

analyzed: de lta bu gang zhig mthong ba de nad kyis nyam thag pa'i nad pa ni 'chi bar 'gyur la /

analyzed: gang zhig nad med cing tha mal par gnas pas rmi lam de lta bu mthong bar gyur na /
translated: If someone who is healthy and well sees such a dream,

analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na nad kyis btab nas 'chi ba 'am 'tsho ba gtol med pa'i the tshom dang bcas par 'gyur la ;

original: mthong dang thos dang nyams myong dang // gsol ba btab dang brtags pa dang // 'byung bar 'gyur dang nad las byung ;🔽/ rmi lam rnam pa bdun du bshad //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong dang thos dang nyams myong dang // gsol ba btab dang brtags pa dang // 'byung bar 'gyur dang nad las byung ; / rmi lam rnam pa bdun du bshad // ces bya ba la /
translated: occurring, and arising from illness.

original: rmi lam gyi dbye ba ni mthong ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas rnam pa bdun du yod do //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dbye ba ni mthong ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas rnam pa bdun du yod do //
translated: The classification of dreams is sevenfold, by way of the aspects of seeing and so on.

original: de la mthong ba'i rmi lam ni gnyid kyis ma log pa'i gnas skabs su mig gis mthong zhing nyams su myong ba de rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su de 'dra ba'i rnam par rmis pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i rmi lam ni gnyid kyis ma log pa'i gnas skabs su mig gis mthong zhing nyams su myong ba de rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su de 'dra ba'i rnam par rmis pa mthong ba'o //
translated: The seen dream is that which one sees and experiences with the eye in the waking state and which one dreams in the same form in the dream state.

original: thos pa ni rna ba'i dbang pos sgra tsam du thos pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni rna ba'i dbang pos sgra tsam du thos pa'o //
translated: The heard dream is that which one hears with the ear faculty as mere sound.

original: nyams su myong ba ni rig pa'i tshul gyis nyams su myong ba'o //🔽gsol ba btab pa ni /🔽don du gnyer zhing yid la 'dod pa'i don gsol ba btab pa'o //

translated: The experienced dream is that which one experiences with the mind.🔽The desired dream is that which one desires and wishes for.

original: @79b brtags pa yid kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du brtags shing yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: @79b brtags pa yid kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du brtags shing yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The imagined dream is that which one imagines and mentally engages with as one wishes.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni phyis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni phyis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The to-be-attained dream is that which will definitely occur in the future.

original: nad las byung ba ni rlung dang / mkhris pa dang bad kan las byung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nad las byung ba ni rlung dang / mkhris pa dang bad kan las byung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The arisen from illness dream is that which arises from wind, bile, and phlegm disorders.

original: de las dang po'i lnga po dang ; / rang gi rang bzhin nyin mo brjed //
analyzed: de las dang po'i lnga po dang ; / rang gi rang bzhin nyin mo brjed //
translated: The first five and one's own nature are exchanged during the day.

original: shin tu ring thung 'bras bu med //
analyzed: shin tu ring thung 'bras bu med //
translated: If very long or short, they are without result.

original: cha 'dres pa yi rang bzhin can //
analyzed: cha 'dres pa yi rang bzhin can //
translated: If of a nature mixed with the humors,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the above,

original: rmi lam de dag gi nang nas /
analyzed: rmi lam de dag gi nang nas /
translated: among those dreams,

original: dang po'i rmi lam lnga po mthong ba la sogs pa lnga ni 'bras bu med cing mi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po'i rmi lam lnga po mthong ba la sogs pa lnga ni 'bras bu med cing mi bden pa yin no //
translated: the first five dreams, such as seeing the five, are without result and are not true.

original: de bzhin du rang gi rang bzhin gyi nad gzhi las byung ba dang / rjes su mthun pa de yang 'bras bu med pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi rang bzhin gyi nad gzhi las byung ba dang / rjes su mthun pa de yang 'bras bu med pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, those that arise from one's own natural illness and are concordant with it are also without result.

original: rlung gi rang bzhin can la rlung gi rang bzhin dang mthun pa rmis pa'i rmi lam dang / mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can la mkhris pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i rmi lam nas /
analyzed: rlung gi rang bzhin can la rlung gi rang bzhin dang mthun pa rmis pa'i rmi lam dang / mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can la mkhris pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i rmi lam nas /
translated: For one of a windy nature, a dream with a nature concordant with wind, for one of a bile nature, a dream concordant with bile,

original: cha 'dres pa'i rang bzhin can la /
analyzed: cha 'dres pa'i rang bzhin can la /
translated: and for one of a mixed nature,

original: cha 'dres pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rmi lam rmis pa yang don med pa yin no //
analyzed: cha 'dres pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rmi lam rmis pa yang don med pa yin no //
translated: a dream of a mixed nature is also meaningless.

original: de bzhin du nyin mo rmis pa yang rmis nas brjed pa dang / shin tu yun ring pa dang / shin tu yun thung ba yang 'bras bu med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyin mo rmis pa yang rmis nas brjed pa dang / shin tu yun ring pa dang / shin tu yun thung ba yang 'bras bu med pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, if one dreams during the day, and then forgets the dream, or if the dream is very long or very short, it is without result.

original: mtshan stod rmi lam 'bras bu ring //
analyzed: mtshan stod rmi lam 'bras bu ring //
translated: A dream at the end of the night has a result that is distant.

original: mthong ba chung ngu byed pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong ba chung ngu byed pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one sees little, the action is small.

original: mtshan stod phyed pa yan chad rmi lam rmis pa ni de'i 'bras bu thag ring ba yin la /
analyzed: mtshan stod phyed pa yan chad rmi lam rmis pa ni de'i 'bras bu thag ring ba yin la /
translated: A dream at the end of the night, that is, after midnight, has a result that is distant.

original: mthong ba de yang shas chung zhing mthong ba zhan pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba de yang shas chung zhing mthong ba zhan pa yin no //
translated: And if one sees little, that is, if the vision is weak, the action is small.

original: nang par mthong dang gnyid ma log / mi mthun gtam gyis bar ma chod //
analyzed: nang par mthong dang gnyid ma log / mi mthun gtam gyis bar ma chod //
translated: If one sees in the morning, or if one is not asleep, or if the dream is interrupted by conversation,

original: de yi nyin par 'bras chen 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽nang par ba lang gzas la gtong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: de yi nyin par 'bras chen 'gyur // zhes bya ba la / nang par ba lang gzas la gtong ba'i tshe /
translated: then the result will be great that very day.

original: rmi lam mthong ba de ni /
analyzed: rmi lam mthong ba de ni /
translated: If one sees a dream at the time of going out in the morning,

original: de'i nyin par nyid 'bras bu chen po mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i nyin par nyid 'bras bu chen po mthong ba yin no //
translated: then the result will be great that very day.

original: yang rmi lam de mthong nas gnyid kyis ma log cing rmi lam gzhan gyis bar ma chod pa dang / de bzhin du de dang mi mthun pa'i tshig gis chod par ma gyur na /
analyzed: yang rmi lam de mthong nas gnyid kyis ma log cing rmi lam gzhan gyis bar ma chod pa dang / de bzhin du de dang mi mthun pa'i tshig gis chod par ma gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if one sees that dream and does not fall asleep again, and if another dream does not intervene, and if a statement contrary to that does not intervene,

original: de de'i nyin par mthong zhing 'bras bu dang yang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de de'i nyin par mthong zhing 'bras bu dang yang bcas pa yin no //
translated: then that dream is seen on that day and has a result.

original: sbyin dang sbyin sreg la sogs kyis //
analyzed: sbyin dang sbyin sreg la sogs kyis //
translated: By giving, by fire offerings, etc.,

original: rmi lam 'bras bu chung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rmi lam 'bras bu chung bar 'gyur //
translated: the result of the dream is small.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gal te rmi lam ngan pa zhig rmis na @80a * //
analyzed: gal te rmi lam ngan pa zhig rmis na @80a * //
translated: if one has a bad dream,

original: de'i rjes la de zhi bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin sreg la sogs pa byas na /
analyzed: de'i rjes la de zhi bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin sreg la sogs pa byas na /
translated: then after that, if one performs fire offerings, etc., in order to pacify it,

original: rmi lam ngan pa de 'bras bu chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmi lam ngan pa de 'bras bu chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the result of that bad dream is small.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni brtul zhugs dang gtsang sbra dang sems nang du 'du zhing bsam gtan la mnyam par 'jog pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / bkra shis kyi cho ga byas pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni brtul zhugs dang gtsang sbra dang sems nang du 'du zhing bsam gtan la mnyam par 'jog pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / bkra shis kyi cho ga byas pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: By the word “etc.,” observances, purity, mental concentration, and the rite of meditative absorption are included.

original: gang zhig rmi lam ngan mthong nas //
analyzed: gang zhig rmi lam ngan mthong nas //
translated: If one sees a bad dream,

original: slar yang gnas skabs de nyid du //
analyzed: slar yang gnas skabs de nyid du //
translated: Again, in that very place,🔽

original: rmi lam bzang po mthong gyur na //
analyzed: rmi lam bzang po mthong gyur na //
translated: If he sees a good dream again in that very situation,

original: 'bras bu bzang po nyid thob 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu bzang po nyid thob 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: he will obtain a good result.

original: gang zhig gis rmi lam ngan zhing mi dge ba mthong zhing rmis nas yang gnas skabs de nyid du rmi lam ngan pa'i rjes la rmi lam bzang zhing dge bar gyur pa mthong na /
analyzed: gang zhig gis rmi lam ngan zhing mi dge ba mthong zhing rmis nas yang gnas skabs de nyid du rmi lam ngan pa'i rjes la rmi lam bzang zhing dge bar gyur pa mthong na /
translated: If someone sees and dreams an inauspicious, bad dream, and then again in that very situation, after the bad dream, he sees a good, auspicious dream,

original: skyes bu des 'bras bu bzang po nyid 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: skyes bu des 'bras bu bzang po nyid 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: that person will obtain a good result.

original: rmi lam ngan pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmi lam ngan pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not come under the influence of the bad dream.🔽Listen, O best of gods and Brahmins,

original: lha dang bram ze khyu mchog dang // ba lang rgyal po mdza' bshes gson //
analyzed: lha dang bram ze khyu mchog dang // ba lang rgyal po mdza' bshes gson //
translated: O king of bulls, O friend!🔽Listen, O best of men, O glorious one,

original: skyes bu dam pa grags ldan dang // me 'bar ba dang dangs pa'i mtsho //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa grags ldan dang // me 'bar ba dang dangs pa'i mtsho //
translated: O blazing fire, O clear lake,🔽O girl, O boy, O yellow one,

original: bu mo khye'u ser ba dang // gos dkar gyon zhing mdangs dang ldan //
analyzed: bu mo khye'u ser ba dang // gos dkar gyon zhing mdangs dang ldan //
translated: O one clothed in white, O radiant one,

original: skyes bus bza' dang lus 'bar dang // khrag gis lus kun byugs pa dag / gang gis mthong bar gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyes bus bza' dang lus 'bar dang // khrag gis lus kun byugs pa dag / gang gis mthong bar gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and one’s own body smeared with blood.

original: lha la sogs pa'i rmi lam bzang po 'di lta bu gang gis mthong ba de tshe ring ba la sogs pa'i yon tan thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa'i rmi lam bzang po 'di lta bu gang gis mthong ba de tshe ring ba la sogs pa'i yon tan thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who sees these good dreams of gods, etc., obtains the good qualities of longevity, etc.

original: lha ni brgya byin dang chu lha la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha ni brgya byin dang chu lha la sogs pa'o //
translated: Gods are Indra, Varuna, etc.

original: mdza' bshes ni mdza' bo ste de yang gson po'o //
analyzed: mdza' bshes ni mdza' bo ste de yang gson po'o //
translated: Friends are living friends.

original: skyes bu dam pa ni chos dang ldan pa'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ni chos dang ldan pa'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: A good man is one who has the character of being endowed with the Dharma.

original: grags ldan ni snyan pas kun tu khyab pa'i mi'o //
analyzed: grags ldan ni snyan pas kun tu khyab pa'i mi'o //
translated: A famous man is one whose good reputation is widespread.

original: me 'bar ba ni shing mang po dang bcas shing 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: me 'bar ba ni shing mang po dang bcas shing 'bar ba'o //
translated: A burning fire is one that is burning with a lot of wood.

original: dangs pa'i mtsho ni rnyog pa med pa'i mtsho'o //
analyzed: dangs pa'i mtsho ni rnyog pa med pa'i mtsho'o //
translated: A clear lake is a lake without turbidity.

original: bu mo dang khye'u ni na tshod dang po la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bu mo dang khye'u ni na tshod dang po la gnas pa ste /
translated: A girl and a boy are those who are in the first stage of life.

original: de yang kha dog ser ba dang / gos dkar po gyon zhing mdangs dang ldan zhing gzugs bzang ba'o //
analyzed: de yang kha dog ser ba dang / gos dkar po gyon zhing mdangs dang ldan zhing gzugs bzang ba'o //
translated: Moreover, he is yellow-colored, wears white garments, is radiant, and has a good figure.

original: skyes bu za ba ni mi'i zas za ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu za ba ni mi'i zas za ba'o //
translated: The man who eats is one who eats human food.

original: lus 'bar ba ni lus me'i phung po ltar 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: lus 'bar ba ni lus me'i phung po ltar 'bar ba'o //
translated: The burning body is one whose body is burning like a mass of fire.

original: khrag gis lus kun bsgos pa ni khrag gis bsgos shing byugs pa ste /
analyzed: khrag gis lus kun bsgos pa ni khrag gis bsgos shing byugs pa ste /
translated: The body smeared with blood is one smeared and anointed with blood.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa gang gis rmi lam du mthong ba de ni dge ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa gang gis rmi lam du mthong ba de ni dge ba yin no //
translated: The one who sees such a form in a dream is virtuous.🔽An umbrella, raw flesh, a mirror, poison,

original: gdugs @80b dang sha rlon me long dug / sna ma dkar pos gos pa dang // mi gtsang gis byugs 'bras bu rnyed //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gdugs @80b dang sha rlon me long dug / sna ma dkar pos gos pa dang // mi gtsang gis byugs 'bras bu rnyed // ces bya ba la /
translated: a white jasmine flower, smeared with filth, and finding fruit.

original: yang skyes bu gang zhig rmi lam gyi nang du gdugs la sogs pa rnyed pa rmis pa des kyang tshe ring ba la sogs pa thob bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang skyes bu gang zhig rmi lam gyi nang du gdugs la sogs pa rnyed pa rmis pa des kyang tshe ring ba la sogs pa thob bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the man who dreams of finding an umbrella and so on will also obtain a long life and so forth.

original: dug ni ha la ha la 'am btsan dug la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dug ni ha la ha la 'am btsan dug la sogs pa'o //
translated: Poison is halahala, aconite, and so on.

original: sna ma'i me tog dkar po ni bar bar na kha dog rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sna ma'i me tog dkar po ni bar bar na kha dog rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The white jasmine flower has four colors in between.

original: mi gtsang bas byugs pa ni bshang bas lus la byugs pa'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang bas byugs pa ni bshang bas lus la byugs pa'o //
translated: Smeared with filth means smeared with excrement on the body.

original: 'bras bu ni aa mra'i shing thog dang / skyu ru ra dang / starga'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //🔽ri bo khang bzangs 'bras bcas shing //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni aa mra'i shing thog dang / skyu ru ra dang / starga'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'o // ri bo khang bzangs 'bras bcas shing //
translated: The fruit is the fruit of the mango, the emblic myrobalan, the jujube, and so on.🔽Climbing a mountain, a palace, a tree with fruit,

original: 'dzeg dang seng ge glang chen rmi //
analyzed: 'dzeg dang seng ge glang chen rmi //
translated: a lion, an elephant,

original: rta dang ba lang dag la zhon //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rta dang ba lang dag la zhon // zhes bya ba la /
translated: a horse, and a bull.

original: rmi lam du ri bor 'dzeg pa la sogs pa rmis pa yang bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmi lam du ri bor 'dzeg pa la sogs pa rmis pa yang bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In a dream, if one dreams of climbing a mountain, and so on, one will obtain happiness.

original: ri bo ni brag ri'o //
analyzed: ri bo ni brag ri'o //
translated: A mountain is a rocky mountain.

original: khang bzangs ni khang pa brtsegs pa'i steng ngo //
analyzed: khang bzangs ni khang pa brtsegs pa'i steng ngo //
translated: A palace is the top of a multi-storied building.

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i shing ni shing tog phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i shing ni shing tog phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: A tree with fruit is one endowed with an abundance of fruit.

original: de dag la 'dzeg pa dang / chu bo mtsho bran rgya mtsho brgal //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag la 'dzeg pa dang / chu bo mtsho bran rgya mtsho brgal // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Climbing those, and crossing a river, a small lake, an ocean,

original: yang mi gang zhig rmi lam du chu bo la sogs pa las brgal zhing thar bar rmis pa de yang bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang mi gang zhig rmi lam du chu bo la sogs pa las brgal zhing thar bar rmis pa de yang bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, if a person dreams of crossing and escaping from a river, and so on, in a dream, they will also obtain happiness.

original: shar dang byang du 'gro ba dang // bgrod min 'gro dang shi ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shar dang byang du 'gro ba dang // bgrod min 'gro dang shi ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Going to the east or north, going where one should not go, and death.

original: yang mi gang shar ram byang gi lam du rmi lam du 'gro ba rmi ba dang / bgrod min 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: yang mi gang shar ram byang gi lam du rmi lam du 'gro ba rmi ba dang / bgrod min 'gro ba ste /
translated: Moreover, if a man dreams that he goes to the east or north, or that he goes where he should not go,

original: rang dang ris mi mthun pa'am /
analyzed: rang dang ris mi mthun pa'am /
translated: or that he goes with those of a different caste,

original: gdol pa la sogs pa spyod pa rmis pa dang ; bdag nyid shi bar rmi ba de yang tshe ring ba la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdol pa la sogs pa spyod pa rmis pa dang ; bdag nyid shi bar rmi ba de yang tshe ring ba la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: or that he engages in the conduct of a caṇḍāla, or that he dies, he will obtain a long life and so forth.🔽Being rescued from danger, being praised by gods, parents, and so forth,

original: nyam nga las thar lha rnams dang // pha mas mngon par bstod pa dang // ngu dang lhung las ldang ba dang // dgra bo pham par byas pa ni //🔽gang rmis tshe ring nad med dang // nor mang po ni rnyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: nyam nga las thar lha rnams dang // pha mas mngon par bstod pa dang // ngu dang lhung las ldang ba dang // dgra bo pham par byas pa ni // gang rmis tshe ring nad med dang // nor mang po ni rnyed par 'gyur //
translated: crying, falling down and rising up, and defeating enemies,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: if one dreams of these, one will obtain a long life, good health, and much wealth.

original: yang gang zhig nyam nga zhing dgos pa'i gnas las thar zhing byung ba dang / de bzhin du lha dang pham la sogs pas rmi lam gyi nang du bstod pa dang bkur ba rmi ba dang / yang gang zhig ngu zhing mchi ma 'byin pa dang /
analyzed: yang gang zhig nyam nga zhing dgos pa'i gnas las thar zhing byung ba dang / de bzhin du lha dang pham la sogs pas rmi lam gyi nang du bstod pa dang bkur ba rmi ba dang / yang gang zhig ngu zhing mchi ma 'byin pa dang /
translated: and if they dream that they cry and shed tears,

original: de bzhin du sa la lhung zhing 'gyel ba @81a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa la lhung zhing 'gyel ba @81a * //
translated: and similarly, that they get up after falling and collapsing on the ground,

original: las ldang ba dang / de bzhin du sdang bar sems pa'i dgra bo pham par byas pa'i rmi lam skyes bu gang zhig rmis par byas pa de tshe ste srog gnas pa dang / nad med pa ste bde bar gnas pa dang / nor dang 'byor pa mang po rnyed cing thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las ldang ba dang / de bzhin du sdang bar sems pa'i dgra bo pham par byas pa'i rmi lam skyes bu gang zhig rmis par byas pa de tshe ste srog gnas pa dang / nad med pa ste bde bar gnas pa dang / nor dang 'byor pa mang po rnyed cing thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and similarly, if someone dreams that they defeat an enemy who is hostile, then that person will live, will live happily with good health, and will obtain and acquire much wealth and property.

original: de bzhin nad pa'i g-yog 'khor ni //
analyzed: de bzhin nad pa'i g-yog 'khor ni //
translated: Similarly, the attendants of the sick

original: bkra shis cho ga phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: bkra shis cho ga phun sum tshogs //
translated: are auspicious, complete in ritual,🔽and in accord with the faithful.

original: dad ldan rjes su mthun pa dang // nor mang bsdus par gyur pa dang // snying stobs mtshan nyid dang ldan zhing //
analyzed: dad ldan rjes su mthun pa dang // nor mang bsdus par gyur pa dang // snying stobs mtshan nyid dang ldan zhing //
translated: They are gathered together in great numbers, and have the characteristics of courage.

original: sman pa bram ze sogs la gus //
analyzed: sman pa bram ze sogs la gus //
translated: Respect for doctors, Brahmins, and so on,

original: gso dpyad rnams la skyo ba med //🔽de ni nad med 'gyur mtshan nyid //
analyzed: gso dpyad rnams la skyo ba med // de ni nad med 'gyur mtshan nyid //
translated: and not being discouraged by medical treatments.

original: ces bya ba la /🔽yang de bzhin du nye du dang chung ma dang bran la sogs pa'i g-yog 'khor yon tan dang ldan pa dang / bkra shis shing dam pa'i spyod pa'i cho ga'i rjes su mthun pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / nad pa dad pa dang ldan pas sman dpyad byas pas nga'i nad legs par sos so zhes yid ches pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: ces bya ba la / yang de bzhin du nye du dang chung ma dang bran la sogs pa'i g-yog 'khor yon tan dang ldan pa dang / bkra shis shing dam pa'i spyod pa'i cho ga'i rjes su mthun pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / nad pa dad pa dang ldan pas sman dpyad byas pas nga'i nad legs par sos so zhes yid ches pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: These are the characteristics of being free from illness.🔽As before, having a retinue of relatives, wives, servants, and so on who have good qualities, being endowed with the perfect qualities that accord with the auspicious and sacred conduct of the rituals, and having the confidence that comes from being a faithful patient who believes that the medical treatment has completely cured their illness.

original: de bzhin du sman pa'i man ngag dang rjes su mthun par byed cing gus pa dang / de bzhin du nor mang du bsdus shing yo byad phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / snying stobs kyi mtshan nyid gtsang sbra dang yod par lta ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sman pa'i man ngag dang rjes su mthun par byed cing gus pa dang / de bzhin du nor mang du bsdus shing yo byad phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / snying stobs kyi mtshan nyid gtsang sbra dang yod par lta ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: Acting in accordance with the doctor's instructions and being respectful, likewise accumulating much wealth and having perfect resources, and having the characteristics of courage such as cleanliness and the view of existence.

original: de bzhin du sman pa dang bram ze la sogs pa la gus shing 'dud pa dang / de bzhin du gso dpyad kyi sbyor ba sman btung ba la sogs pa la skyo zhing sgyid lug pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sman pa dang bram ze la sogs pa la gus shing 'dud pa dang / de bzhin du gso dpyad kyi sbyor ba sman btung ba la sogs pa la skyo zhing sgyid lug pa med pa ste /
translated: Likewise, he is respectful and deferential to physicians, Brahmins, and so forth, and likewise, he is not weary or discouraged in the application of medical treatment, taking medicine, and so forth.

original: 'khor dang rang gi yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni nad med cing bde ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid dam rtags yin no //
analyzed: 'khor dang rang gi yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni nad med cing bde ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid dam rtags yin no //
translated: Whoever has such a retinue and good qualities has the characteristic or sign of being free from illness and happy.🔽Always gathering what is auspicious

original: rtag tu shis pa sdud pa dang // bkra mi shis pa rnam par spang //🔽'di dag de nyid mthong ba yi //
analyzed: rtag tu shis pa sdud pa dang // bkra mi shis pa rnam par spang // 'di dag de nyid mthong ba yi //
translated: and abandoning what is inauspicious,🔽these are explained as auspicious

original: drang srong rnams kyis shis par bshad //
analyzed: drang srong rnams kyis shis par bshad //
translated: by the seers who see reality.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: yang dus rtag tu bkra shis par 'gyur ba'i dngos po sdud cing nye bar bsags pa dang / bkra mi shis pa'i dngos po nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad nye bar spong zhing 'dor bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yang dus rtag tu bkra shis par 'gyur ba'i dngos po sdud cing nye bar bsags pa dang / bkra mi shis pa'i dngos po nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad nye bar spong zhing 'dor bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: one always gathers and accumulates things that are auspicious and abandons and discards all the characteristics of things that are inauspicious to be used.

original: sdud pa dang spang ba 'di dag ni de kho na nyid mthong zhing mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i drang @81b srong rnams kyis bkra shis shing dge bar 'gyur bar bshad pa des kyang nad med pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: sdud pa dang spang ba 'di dag ni de kho na nyid mthong zhing mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i drang @81b srong rnams kyis bkra shis shing dge bar 'gyur bar bshad pa des kyang nad med pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad do //
translated: These collections and abandonments are explained by the sages who see reality and possess the five superknowledges as auspicious and virtuous. By that, it is explained as having the characteristic of being free from disease.

original: de ltar 'di ni skye dang 'chi //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni skye dang 'chi //
translated: Thus, this is the characteristic of birth and death.

original: mtshan nyid gang phyir bshad pas na //🔽de phyir lus kyi gnas yin pas //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang phyir bshad pas na // de phyir lus kyi gnas yin pas //
translated: Because it is explained,🔽it is the abode of the body.

original: 'di ni lus kyi gnas su bshad //
analyzed: 'di ni lus kyi gnas su bshad //
translated: Therefore, it is explained as the abode of the body.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rdzogs pa ste /
translated: the word “thus” is complete.

original: lus kyi gnas 'dir lus de'i skye ba dang 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa gang gi phyir bshad cing bstan pa nas /
analyzed: lus kyi gnas 'dir lus de'i skye ba dang 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa gang gi phyir bshad cing bstan pa nas /
translated: Because the characteristic of birth and death of that body is explained and taught in this abode of the body,

original: rgyu de'i phyir lus kyi gnas kyi skye ba dang 'chi ba yin pas /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir lus kyi gnas kyi skye ba dang 'chi ba yin pas /
translated: for that reason, since it is the birth and death of the abode of the body,

original: gnas 'di ni lus kyi gnas yin no zhes bshad cing bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas 'di ni lus kyi gnas yin no zhes bshad cing bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: la lar ni bsod nams kyi dbang gis rlung las gyur pa yin yang gso sla ba ni yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: dbyar dus rlung nad ldang gyur na //
analyzed: dbyar dus rlung nad ldang gyur na //

original: mkhris pa bad kan ldan rims 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mkhris pa bad kan ldan rims 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: gang gi tshe dbyar gyi dus su rlung nad ldang zhing 'khrugs par gyur nas rims skyed par byed pa de'i tshe /

original: mkhris pa dang bad kan dang ldan pa'i rims su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mkhris pa dang bad kan dang ldan pa'i rims su 'gyur gyi /

analyzed: de dang mi ldan pa ma yin te / de'i tshe rims de rlung las gyur pa yin du zin kyang mkhris pa dang bad kan dang ldan pas mngon par ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: They are not without those [humors].🔽Even though that fever is due to wind, it manifests with bile and phlegm.

original: ston ka mkhris pas nad slong ste //
analyzed: ston ka mkhris pas nad slong ste //

original: bad kan de yi grogs byed 'gyur //
analyzed: bad kan de yi grogs byed 'gyur //

original: der ni smyung ba byas gyur kyang //
analyzed: der ni smyung ba byas gyur kyang //

analyzed: gnod par 'gyur ba ma yin no //🔽zhes bya ba la /

original: ston ka'i dus su mkhris pa 'khrugs nas rims skyed par byed la /
analyzed: ston ka'i dus su mkhris pa 'khrugs nas rims skyed par byed la /

original: rims skyed par rtsom pa'i mkhris pa de'i stobs sam grogs skyed pa ni bad kan yin pas /
analyzed: rims skyed par rtsom pa'i mkhris pa de'i stobs sam grogs skyed pa ni bad kan yin pas /

original: des grogs byas nas skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des grogs byas nas skye bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: rims ni ma zhu ba'i gnas la @94b brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: des gnas skabs der ni bad kan dang mkhris pa gnyis ni smyung bar byas pas gso bar bya zhing bcos dgos pa yin pas na /

analyzed: gnas skabs 'dir smyung ba byas pa las gnod cing nad du 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pa yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this situation, there is the danger of harm and illness from fasting.

original: bad kan dpyid ldang de yang ni //
analyzed: bad kan dpyid ldang de yang ni //

original: de rjes rlung dang mkhris pa 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de rjes rlung dang mkhris pa 'byung // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: dpyid kyi dus su ni bad kan 'khrugs shing ldang nas rims skyed par byed pa yin la /

analyzed: bad kan yang de'i rjes la rlung dang mkhris pa gnyis grogs byed cing stobs skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Phlegm, after that, assists wind and bile, and increases their strength.

original: nyams stobs che zhing nad tshabs chung //
analyzed: nyams stobs che zhing nad tshabs chung //
translated: When a person has great strength and the disease is slight,

original: bla brnan med rims gso bar sla //
analyzed: bla brnan med rims gso bar sla //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

analyzed: skyes bu lang tsho phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa nyams stobs che ba dang / de bzhin du nad tshabs kyi dkyel chung ba dang / lud pa dang dbugs mi bde ba'i bla brnan med pa'i rims nad gang yin pa de ni myur du bde bar bya bar nus pas na gso sla ba yin no //
translated: when a person has great strength, such as being in the prime of youth, and similarly, when the disease is slight, and when there are no complications of phlegm, cough, and dyspnea, then any fever can be quickly made well, so it is easy to cure.

original: rnam kun 'gyur ba zhes bya bar //
analyzed: rnam kun 'gyur ba zhes bya bar //
translated: It is said that in all cases,

original: gsor mi rung bar sngar bshad do //
analyzed: gsor mi rung bar sngar bshad do //
translated: the incurable was explained before.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: yong ye rnam pa thams cad du lus kyi 'gyur ba shes par bya ba'i lus kyi gnas su gsor mi rung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rims sngar bshad de /
analyzed: yong ye rnam pa thams cad du lus kyi 'gyur ba shes par bya ba'i lus kyi gnas su gsor mi rung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rims sngar bshad de /
translated: the characteristics of an incurable fever were explained before, in the section on the body, to be known by all the changes in the body.

original: rims ni tshabs che zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig sngar bshad pa yin no //🔽rims kyi nad tshabs che zhing tsha //

translated: “Severe” means the illness is severe.🔽“Emaciation” means the body is very thin.🔽“Weakness” means the body is very weak.🔽“Much urine” means the urine is very abundant.🔽“Difficult defecation” means the feces are difficult to pass.

original: khong rmya nyam chung gcin mang dang // bshang sri kha zas mi 'ju la //
analyzed: khong rmya nyam chung gcin mang dang // bshang sri kha zas mi 'ju la //

original: bkres chung ma smin rims mtshan nyid //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bkres chung ma smin rims mtshan nyid // ces bya ba la /

analyzed: rims ma smin pa'i mtshan nyid 'di dag yin te /
translated: These are the characteristics of immature fever.🔽“Severe” means the illness is severe, affecting the vital points and joints.

analyzed: rims kyi nad tshabs gnad dang tshigs la sogs pa na ba'i tshabs che zhing /

analyzed: de bzhin du khong shin tu rmya zhing nyam chung ba yin te /
translated: “Weakness” means the body is very weak.🔽“Much urine” means the urine is very abundant.🔽“Difficult defecation” means the feces are difficult to pass.🔽“Indigestion” means food is not digested.

original: stobs dang srog par bcas pa gcin mang du 'byung ba dang / bshang gci sri zhing mi 'byung ba dang / kha zas 'ju bar mi byed pa dang / bkres pa med cing zas mi 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: stobs dang srog par bcas pa gcin mang du 'byung ba dang / bshang gci sri zhing mi 'byung ba dang / kha zas 'ju bar mi byed pa dang / bkres pa med cing zas mi 'dod pa ste /
translated: “Little hunger” means there is little desire for food.

analyzed: 'di dag ni rims ma smin pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: These should be known as the characteristics of immature fever.🔽“Great strength” means the fever is strong.

original: rims shugs stobs che skom dad che //
analyzed: rims shugs stobs che skom dad che //
translated: “Great thirst” means there is great desire for water.

original: bla zhing mgo 'khor @95a * //
analyzed: bla zhing mgo 'khor @95a * //
translated: high fever, delirium,

original: dbugs mi bde //
analyzed: dbugs mi bde //
translated: difficulty in breathing,

analyzed: bshang gci bder 'byung nad bskyod pa // smin par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the easy passage of feces and urine.🔽The signs of the maturation of a fever are: the strength and power of the fever are great;

original: rims smin pa'i nye ba'i mtshan ma ni rims kyi shugs drag cing stobs che ba dang / de nyid kyis na skom dad che ba dang / bla zhing tshig 'khyal pa dang / bshang gci bde bar 'byung zhing mi sri ba dang / nad bskyod cing bslongs pa ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: rims smin pa'i nye ba'i mtshan ma ni rims kyi shugs drag cing stobs che ba dang / de nyid kyis na skom dad che ba dang / bla zhing tshig 'khyal pa dang / bshang gci bde bar 'byung zhing mi sri ba dang / nad bskyod cing bslongs pa ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: because of that, there is great thirst; there is high fever and delirium; the easy passage of feces and urine without obstruction; and the appearance of the fever moving and stirring.🔽The signs of the maturation of a fever are the opposite of those.

original: ma smin go bzlog mtshan nyid dang // zhag bdun smyung byas las smin bshad //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ma smin go bzlog mtshan nyid dang // zhag bdun smyung byas las smin bshad // ces bya ba la /
translated: It is said that the maturation of the fever occurs after seven days of fasting.

analyzed: rims smin cing nad med pa'i mtshan nyid ni rims nad tshabs che ba la sogs pa go bzlog pa las shes par bya ste /

analyzed: rims nad kyi tshabs chung ba bri ba dang / khong rmya zhing nyam chung ba dang / gcin nyung ba dang / bshang ba bde bar 'byung ba la sogs pa de ni rims ma zhu ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin la ;
translated: The signs of the absence of undigested contagious fever are: the fever subsides, the patient becomes thin and weak, has little urine, and passes stool easily.

analyzed: de bzhin du zhag bdun gyi bar du smyung ba byas pa las rims de smin te smin zhing 'ju ba nyid du 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should know that after fasting for seven days, the fever will ripen and be digested.

original: de yang drang srong tsa ra kas /
analyzed: de yang drang srong tsa ra kas /
translated: The sage Caraka explains:

original: lus zungs kun gnas nad rnams ni //
analyzed: lus zungs kun gnas nad rnams ni //

analyzed: zhag bdun gyis ni smin par 'gyur // rims nad phal cher nad rnams ni //
translated: will ripen in seven days.🔽It is said that most fevers

original: smyung byas smin pa yin zhes bshad //
analyzed: smyung byas smin pa yin zhes bshad //

original: ces bshad pa yin no //🔽rims ni nad kyi dus dang ni //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no // rims ni nad kyi dus dang ni //
translated: And:🔽Fever is explained as having five types:

analyzed: stobs chung che las rnam lngar bshad // phal cher 'dus par gyur pa yi //
translated: the time of the disease,🔽the weak, and the strong.🔽It is explained that most fevers

analyzed: rims su mang du 'gyur bar bshad //
translated: become many due to their combination.

original: rgyun dang rtag pa nyin gcig pa //
analyzed: rgyun dang rtag pa nyin gcig pa //

original: nyin gsum pa dang nyin bzhi pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyin gsum pa dang nyin bzhi pa'o // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: rims nad kyi grangs ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rgyun la sogs pa'i rnam pa lnga yod do zhes drang srong chen po rnams kyis bshad do //
translated: The sages explain that the number of fevers is five, such as continuous and so on, which will be explained below.

original: de gang las ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de gang las ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: dus dang yul dang stobs che chung las gyur te /

translated: The strength of fevers such as wind is strong or weak, and similarly, the time of disturbance of the underlying conditions for the occurrence of fevers, and the weakness or strength of the place,

analyzed: yang na nad rnams kyi dus yin pas na nad kyi dus te /

translated: From the strength of day, night, season, and the portion of food eaten, the illness either ends or increases.

original: de yang rnam lngar bshad do //
analyzed: de yang rnam lngar bshad do //

analyzed: de las kyang 'dus pa'i rims ni phal cher ram /

analyzed: phal cher zhes smos pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba yod pa'i don te /
translated: The term “majority” means that there are variations.

original: de yang gzhung gzhan las /
analyzed: de yang gzhung gzhan las /

analyzed: rlung las phal cher rtag par 'gyur //

original: mkhris las phal cher nyin gsum pa //
analyzed: mkhris las phal cher nyin gsum pa //

translated: The terms “chronic” and so on indicate the names of the five types of contagious fevers.

original: lus zungs bshang gci rgyu ba yi //
analyzed: lus zungs bshang gci rgyu ba yi //

analyzed: bu ga nad kyis khyab byas pas //

original: lus kun tsha bar gyur nas ni //
analyzed: lus kun tsha bar gyur nas ni //

original: khyad par du ni dangs mar gnas //

analyzed: gnyen pos bcos dka' bzod par dka' //

analyzed: rgyun gyi rims su 'gyur ba yin // zhes bya ba la /

original: rlung la sogs pa'i nad 'khrugs pas na shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i rgyun gyi rims su 'gyur zhing skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i nad 'khrugs pas na shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i rgyun gyi rims su 'gyur zhing skyed par byed do //
translated: The chronic disease is generated by the disturbance of the humors of wind, etc.

analyzed: de yang lus zungs la sogs par rgyu zhing 'gro bar byed pa'i bu ga rnams nang kyis khyab par byas shing kun tu phyin par byas la /

translated: The body is tormented by the heat of the fever, and the disease increases and spreads in accordance with the humors, the seasons, the country, and the nature of the disease.

analyzed: gnod bya ni lus zungs bdun dang dri ma rnams so //
translated: The humors are the seven bodily constituents and the impurities.

analyzed: dus tshigs ni dbyar ka la sogs pa'o //

original: yul ni rlan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul ni rlan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The country is a humid place, etc.

original: rang bzhin ni bdun no //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni bdun no //
translated: The nature is the seven humors.

analyzed: de yang stobs che ba ste nus pa dang ldan pa dus yun rid po la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du lci zhing brnag dka' la /

analyzed: lus kyis mi thegs pa snyam du sems pa dang / yan lag @96a * //

translated: In particular, it is difficult to treat with remedies that are based on the bodily constituents called the 'very pure elements'.

original: gnod bya la sogs pa dang cha mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod bya la sogs pa dang cha mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is incurable by any means, because it is equal to the one to be harmed and so on.

original: yang de bzhin du bzod par rab tu dka' ba ste /
analyzed: yang de bzhin du bzod par rab tu dka' ba ste /

analyzed: sdug bsngal zhing brnag par mi nus pa'i rims la ni rgyun gyi rims zhes bya ste /
translated: because the fever of an incurable disease is called 'continuous fever'.

original: de lta bur 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is like that.

original: de yi drod kyis dri ma dang // lus zungs myur du zad par byed //
analyzed: de yi drod kyis dri ma dang // lus zungs myur du zad par byed //
translated: By its heat, impurities and bodily constituents are quickly exhausted.

original: de 'og rnam kun lus zungs sogs //
analyzed: de 'og rnam kun lus zungs sogs //
translated: After that, in all cases, the bodily constituents and so on

original: dag pa'am ma dag rims kyis ni //
analyzed: dag pa'am ma dag rims kyis ni //
translated: are purified or not by the fever.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa bad kan zhag / bdun nam bcu'am bcu gnyis gnas //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa bad kan zhag / bdun nam bcu'am bcu gnyis gnas //
translated: The wind, bile, and phlegm remain for seven, ten, or twelve days.

original: phal cher mtshams las mi 'da' bar //
analyzed: phal cher mtshams las mi 'da' bar //
translated: For the most part, they do not pass beyond the boundary.

original: 'tsho ba'am 'chi ba dag tu byed //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'am 'chi ba dag tu byed //
translated: They either live or die.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: With regard to that,🔽the heat of the fever enters the impurities, that is, the feces and so on, and the body constituents such as the refined elements.

original: rims de'i drod kyi tsha bas dri ma ste bshang ba la sogs pa dang / dangs ma la sogs pa'i lus zungs rnams kyi nang du zhugs pa'i rgyus rims des dri ma rnams zad par byed pa'am /
analyzed: rims de'i drod kyi tsha bas dri ma ste bshang ba la sogs pa dang / dangs ma la sogs pa'i lus zungs rnams kyi nang du zhugs pa'i rgyus rims des dri ma rnams zad par byed pa'am /
translated: By the force of that, the fever either exhausts the impurities🔽or, having exhausted the body constituents,

original: lus zungs rnams kyang zad par byas nas de'i 'og tu rnam pa kun du ste /
analyzed: lus zungs rnams kyang zad par byas nas de'i 'og tu rnam pa kun du ste /
translated: then in every way,

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du lus zungs bshang ba dang gci ba dang bcas pa dag ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du lus zungs bshang ba dang gci ba dang bcas pa dag ste /
translated: that is, in all ways, the body constituents together with the feces and urine

original: rims kyi tsha bas dri ma med par byas pa'am /
analyzed: rims kyi tsha bas dri ma med par byas pa'am /
translated: are purified by the heat of the fever.

original: yang na yan lag 'ga' lus zungs la sogs pa ma dag cing ljan ljin dang bcas pa'i rims kyis grangs ji lta ba bzhin du rlung la sogs pa'i nad gzhi las zhag bdun nam bcu'am bcu gnyis kyi bar du phal cher gnas pa'i mtshams sam /
analyzed: yang na yan lag 'ga' lus zungs la sogs pa ma dag cing ljan ljin dang bcas pa'i rims kyis grangs ji lta ba bzhin du rlung la sogs pa'i nad gzhi las zhag bdun nam bcu'am bcu gnyis kyi bar du phal cher gnas pa'i mtshams sam /
translated: Or, if some limbs are not pure, such as the body constituents and so on, and are accompanied by impurities, then the fever remains for seven, ten, or twelve days, in accordance with the number of limbs, and does not pass beyond the time of the illness of wind and so on.

original: dus kyi nges pa las ni mi 'da' bar rjes su gnas te /
analyzed: dus kyi nges pa las ni mi 'da' bar rjes su gnas te /
translated: It remains in accordance with the time.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽dus de tsam gyi nang du 'chi ba'am /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / dus de tsam gyi nang du 'chi ba'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: rims kyis gtong bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rims kyis gtong bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Because within that time, the fever will either kill or🔽release the person,

original: 'chi zhing gsod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'chi zhing gsod par 'gyur te /
translated: or it will kill and destroy.

original: nyin zhag 'di tsam gyis gtong ba'am gsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyin zhag 'di tsam gyis gtong ba'am gsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will either release or kill within this number of days.

original: de yang gang rlung shas che ba las byung ba de ni phal cher zhag bdun gyis gtong ba'am 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gang rlung shas che ba las byung ba de ni phal cher zhag bdun gyis gtong ba'am 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if it arises from an excess of wind, it will either release or kill the person after seven days.

original: de bzhin du mkhris pa shas che ba las byung ba ni zhag bcus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du mkhris pa shas che ba las byung ba ni zhag bcus so //
translated: If it arises from an excess of bile, it will do so after ten days.

original: @96b bad kan shas che ba las byung ba ni bcu gnyis kyis bye brag phyed par 'gyur ba ni rims kyis sbyar ba'i don no //
analyzed: @96b bad kan shas che ba las byung ba ni bcu gnyis kyis bye brag phyed par 'gyur ba ni rims kyis sbyar ba'i don no //
translated: The twelve are the twelve humors. The meaning of distinguished is distinguished by the twelve.

original: de skad me bzhin 'jug gis bshad //
analyzed: de skad me bzhin 'jug gis bshad //
translated: Thus it is explained by Agniveśa.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In this passage,

original: de lta bu de ni sman dpyad kyi gzhung rtsom par byed pa drang srong me bzhin 'jug ces bya bas bshad pa'i gzhung yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu de ni sman dpyad kyi gzhung rtsom par byed pa drang srong me bzhin 'jug ces bya bas bshad pa'i gzhung yin no //
translated: the thus refers to the treatise composed by the sage named Agniveśa, which is the treatise that is explained.

original: ljang sngon gyis ni bshad pa'i gzhung //
analyzed: ljang sngon gyis ni bshad pa'i gzhung //
translated: The treatise explained by Śrīghana

original: bdun pa nyis bldab gyur pa yin //
analyzed: bdun pa nyis bldab gyur pa yin //
translated: is doubled seven times.

original: de bzhin dgu dang bcu gcig bldab //
analyzed: de bzhin dgu dang bcu gcig bldab //
translated: Similarly, it is doubled nine and eleven times.🔽This is the word for the three types of illness,

original: 'di ni nad gzhi gsum gyi tshig /'tsho dang 'chi bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni nad gzhi gsum gyi tshig /'tsho dang 'chi bar byed pa yin //
translated: which cause life and death.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this passage,

original: drang srong ljang sngon zhes bya bas bshad pa'i gzhung ni 'og nas bshad pa'i tshul 'dir ston pa yin te /
analyzed: drang srong ljang sngon zhes bya bas bshad pa'i gzhung ni 'og nas bshad pa'i tshul 'dir ston pa yin te /
translated: the treatise explained by the sage named Śrīghana is taught here in the manner that will be explained below.

original: bdun pa ni nyis bldab tu brtsi ste /
analyzed: bdun pa ni nyis bldab tu brtsi ste /
translated: The seven are counted as doubled.

original: rlung gi rims kyis zhag bcu bzhi na dangs ma la sogs pa dang ma dag pa gang yin pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: rlung gi rims kyis zhag bcu bzhi na dangs ma la sogs pa dang ma dag pa gang yin pa yang rung ste /
translated: In the case of a wind fever, after fourteen days, whether the fever is pure or impure,

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhag bcu bzhis 'tsho ba'am 'chi bar 'gyur ba bye brag phyed par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhag bcu bzhis 'tsho ba'am 'chi bar 'gyur ba bye brag phyed par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: it will be determined whether the person will live or die.

original: gnyis pa ni zhag dgu pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni zhag dgu pa ste /
translated: The second is the ninth day.

original: de yang nyis bldab tu brtsis la zhag bcva brgyad du bya ste /🔽mkhris pa shas che ba'i rims ni zhag bcva brgyad kyis 'tsho ba'am /
analyzed: de yang nyis bldab tu brtsis la zhag bcva brgyad du bya ste / mkhris pa shas che ba'i rims ni zhag bcva brgyad kyis 'tsho ba'am /
translated: That is doubled to make eighteen days.

original: 'chi ba'i bye brag phyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i bye brag phyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: A fever of excess bile will be determined whether the person will live or die.

original: de bzhin du gsum pa ni zhag bcu gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum pa ni zhag bcu gcig pa yin te /
translated: The third is the eleventh day.🔽That is doubled to make twenty-two days.

original: 'di nyis bldab tu byas pas zhag nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyis bad kan gyi shas che ba'i rims kyi bye brag phyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di nyis bldab tu byas pas zhag nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyis bad kan gyi shas che ba'i rims kyi bye brag phyed par 'gyur te /
translated: A fever of excess phlegm will be determined.

original: 'di dag ni nad gzhi gsum las byung ba'i rims kyi dus tshigs kyi bye brag rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nad gzhi gsum las byung ba'i rims kyi dus tshigs kyi bye brag rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: These are the classifications of the seasons of fevers arising from the three humors.

original: rims dus dag dang ma dag las //
analyzed: rims dus dag dang ma dag las //
translated: From pure and impure times of fever,

original: yun ring dus su gnas pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yun ring dus su gnas pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It will last for a long time.

original: de la dag pa'i nad dang bshang ba dang gci ba legs par smin pa rtse zhil zhing ma smin pa'i skyon med pa yin la /
analyzed: de la dag pa'i nad dang bshang ba dang gci ba legs par smin pa rtse zhil zhing ma smin pa'i skyon med pa yin la /
translated: Here, “pure” means that the feces, urine, and so forth are well-formed and not defective due to being under- or over-ripe.

original: de las go bzlog pa ni ma smin pa yin te /
analyzed: de las go bzlog pa ni ma smin pa yin te /
translated: The opposite of that is “immature.”

original: dag pa dang ma dag pa de gnyis cha 'dres pa las ni dus yun ring mo zhig tu gnas shing sngar bshad pa'i dus las yun ring du gnas te /
analyzed: dag pa dang ma dag pa de gnyis cha 'dres pa las ni dus yun ring mo zhig tu gnas shing sngar bshad pa'i dus las yun ring du gnas te /
translated: When the pure and impure are mixed, it will last for a long time, longer than the time explained above.

original: gang gi tshe lus zungs kyi dangs ma la la ni dag cing smin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lus zungs kyi dangs ma la la ni dag cing smin /
translated: When some of the body’s pure essence is pure and ripe,

original: la la ni ma dag cing ma smin par 'gyur na /🔽de'i tshe rgyun gyi rims 'byang zhing 'dor @97a * //
analyzed: la la ni ma dag cing ma smin par 'gyur na / de'i tshe rgyun gyi rims 'byang zhing 'dor @97a * //
translated: and some is impure and unripe,

original: bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: at that time the chronic illness will not be cured and will not be eliminated.

original: yun ring du gnas pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yun ring du gnas pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: It will only last for a long time.🔽When the illness is well-formed, weak,

original: nad rtse zhil ba nyam chung dang // kha zas mi 'phrod sogs bsten pas //
analyzed: nad rtse zhil ba nyam chung dang // kha zas mi 'phrod sogs bsten pas //
translated: and one relies on unwholesome food and so forth,

original: nad dkyel chung yang gnod bya sogs //
analyzed: nad dkyel chung yang gnod bya sogs //
translated: even a small illness will be harmful and so forth.

original: brten te stobs che nyid gyur las //
analyzed: brten te stobs che nyid gyur las //
translated: Relying on that, it will become strong.

original: gnyen por bcas shing 'phel 'bri gnas //
analyzed: gnyen por bcas shing 'phel 'bri gnas //
translated: It is incurable when it is associated with a remedy, and when it increases and decreases.

original: mi bzad pa ni nyid du 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi bzad pa ni nyid du 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is incurable when it is associated with a remedy, and when it increases and decreases.

original: nad kyi rtse zhil zhing nad las thar ba'i skyes bu nyam chung zhing lus rid par gyur pa dang / kha zas mi 'phrod pa la sogs pa bsten pa ste /
analyzed: nad kyi rtse zhil zhing nad las thar ba'i skyes bu nyam chung zhing lus rid par gyur pa dang / kha zas mi 'phrod pa la sogs pa bsten pa ste /
translated: The person who is weak and emaciated from a disease, and who is not cured of the disease, and who eats unwholesome food, etc.,

original: zas dang skom dang sman dang spyod lam mi mthun zhing mi 'phrod pa bsten pa'i rgyus rlung la sogs pa'i nad gang yang rung ba dkyel chung zhing stobs shin tu zhan pa yin yang mi bzad pa'i rims rgyun gyi rims la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas dang skom dang sman dang spyod lam mi mthun zhing mi 'phrod pa bsten pa'i rgyus rlung la sogs pa'i nad gang yang rung ba dkyel chung zhing stobs shin tu zhan pa yin yang mi bzad pa'i rims rgyun gyi rims la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: by the cause of eating food, drink, medicine, and conduct that is not suitable and unwholesome, any disease such as wind, etc., even if it is slight and very weak, becomes an incurable chronic disease, etc.

original: de yang tsha ba mi bzod pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis 'debs pa na mi bzad pa'i rims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang tsha ba mi bzod pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis 'debs pa na mi bzad pa'i rims zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, when it afflicts by the method of not being able to tolerate heat, etc., it is called an incurable chronic disease.

original: de yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does that occur?

original: gnod bya la sogs pa gang yang rung ba la brten zhing gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnod bya la sogs pa gang yang rung ba la brten zhing gnas pa ste /
translated: It is based on and abides in any of the afflicted, etc.

original: lan 'ga' ni gnod bya la sogs pas khrag la sogs pa gang yang rung ba brten la /
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni gnod bya la sogs pas khrag la sogs pa gang yang rung ba brten la /
translated: Sometimes, it is based on blood or any other [humors] of the one to be harmed.

original: lan 'ga' ni nyin mtshan la sogs pa'i dus la brten la /
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni nyin mtshan la sogs pa'i dus la brten la /
translated: Sometimes, it is based on time, such as day and night.

original: lan 'ga' ni rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la brten te /
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la brten te /
translated: Sometimes, it is based on the nature of wind and so forth.

original: de ni tshabs chen por 'gyur ba'i stobs dang / nus pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni tshabs chen por 'gyur ba'i stobs dang / nus pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: That [wind] obtains the power and ability to become very strong.

original: de yang gnyen po dang bcas pa yin zhing bcos pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de yang gnyen po dang bcas pa yin zhing bcos pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, it is accompanied by antidotes and has a method of treatment.

original: yang de ni 'phel ba dang 'bri ba gnyis po la brten zhing gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: yang de ni 'phel ba dang 'bri ba gnyis po la brten zhing gnas pa yin no //
translated: Also, it is based on both increase and decrease, and it abides.

original: de rnams kyis ni nad kyi stobs //
analyzed: de rnams kyis ni nad kyi stobs //
translated: By those, the strength of the illness

original: rang gi dus su rims stobs skyed //
analyzed: rang gi dus su rims stobs skyed //
translated: is generated in its own time.
